main event: The sighting of unidentified aerial phenomena occurred on March 3, 1968 in the vicinity of Northeastern University, Boston, Massachusetts.
interesting points: The object appeared to be about the size of a basketball at arm's length, oval in shape, with a silvery metallic exterior.
The object was observed to be hovering stationary at an estimated altitude of 1,000 to 1,500 feet.
No wings, fins, or other appendages were visible on the object.
The object appeared to be emitting a fluorescent glow that pulsed or fluctuated at an irregular rate.
At one point, the object appeared to be surrounded by a faint halo or 'corona' which was visible for a brief period.
location: Vicinity of Northeastern University, Boston, Massachusetts
